content.description:
This is a really nice finger crack that has seen extensive cleaning and wants more.    

  The crux is probably getting over the bulge, but face holds help.   This is great crack to practice on, as it can be climbed in several different ways.
content.protection: This is pretty short so more of a boulder problem, but it would take gear.  Setting up a top rope is a pain because there no nearby trees.
content.location: This is further to left of the main South Dome area down a slight hill and bit shaded, but it is part of the same cliff band.

content.description:
This is a temporary subarea to allow Crotch Slab to be placed under South Dome.  The challenge is that a boulder problem was added under South Dome which leads to a "child-parent" incompatibility.  So, we had to move that boulder problem to a new "Miscellaneous" subarea.  Then we could move Crotch Slab to South Dome.  Then, we moved "Miscellaneous" to South Dome. 

  Now, you can either move the boulder problem to Crotch Slab or fill in this subarea with additional information.
